architectural_notes: Consider adding a deployment/version rollback mechanism to revert to a known good site state.
known_issues: User reports the site no longer matches the previous version and requests reverting recent changes (possible regression).

existing_features.title: Remove the recently introduced "live blink" icon animation across the site by eliminating usage of the `icon-live-blink-2s` class and removing (or disabling) the corresponding CSS animation so icons no longer blink.

Restore headings to their previous styling by removing the `heading-primary-live` class wherever applied and removing (or disabling) its CSS so headings are no longer forced to dark red and do not blink.

Restore modal/overlay close (X) buttons to their previous appearance by removing the `close-x-live-blink-3s` class from all close icons and removing (or disabling) its CSS so close icons are not forced red and do not blink.

Audit and revert any other visual changes introduced specifically to support the new blinking/color update set (including any helper classes added only for that update) so the site matches the look and behavior of the pre-change version.

new_feature_requests.summary: Restore/rollback the site to the previous version (as it was before the recent changes)
